content:
FileListBox Class

In this Article

Locates and lists files in the directory specified by the crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox.Path* property at run time.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.ComponentModel.Designer(typeof(Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.CompatibilityListBoxDesigner))]
[System.Obsolete("Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.* classes are obsolete and supported within 32 bit processes only. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=160862")]
public class FileListBox : System.Windows.Forms.ListBox

Remarks

Use this control to display a list of files selected by file type. You can create dialog boxes in your application that, for example, enable the user to select a file or group of files.

If you also display the DriveListBox and DirListBox controls, you can write code to synchronize them with the FileListBox control and with each other.

> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

Constructors summary

FileListBox()

Initializes a new instance of the FileListBox class.

Properties summary

Archive

Gets or sets a value that determines whether a FileListBox control displays files that have Archive attributes.
DataSource

Gets or sets the data source for a ListControl.
DisplayMember

Gets or sets the property to display for this ListControl.
FileName

Gets or sets the file name of the selected file in a FileListBox.
Hidden

Gets or sets a value that determines whether a FileListBox control displays files that have Hidden attributes.
ItemHeight

Gets the height of an item in the ListBox.
Items

Gets the items that are contained in a ListBox.
Items(Int32)

Gets the items that are contained in a ListBox.
Normal

Gets or sets a value that determines whether a FileListBox control displays files that have Normal attributes.
Path

Gets or sets the current path for a FileListBox.
Pattern

Gets or sets a value indicating the file names displayed in a FileListBox control at run time.
ReadOnly

Gets or sets a value that determines whether a FileListBox control contains files that have read-only attributes.
Sorted

Gets a value indicating whether the items in a FileListBox are sorted alphabetically.
System

Gets or sets a value that determines whether a FileListBox control displays files that have System attributes.
ValueMember

Gets or sets the property to use as the actual value for the items in a ListControl.

Methods summary

OnDoubleClick(EventArgs)

Raises the DoubleClick event.
OnPathChange(EventArgs)

Raises the PathChange event.
OnPatternChange(EventArgs)

Raises the PatternChange event.
OnSelectedIndexChanged(EventArgs)

Raises the SelectedIndexChanged event.
Refresh()

Forces the control to invalidate its client area and immediately redraw itself.

Events summary

PathChange

Occurs when the path is changed by setting the crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox.FileName* or crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox.Path* property in code.
PatternChange

Occurs when the file listing pattern, such as ".\", is changed by setting the crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox.FileName* or crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox.Pattern* property in code.

Constructors

  • FileListBox()

    Initializes a new instance of the FileListBox class.

    public FileListBox ();

    Remarks

    A FileListBox displays a list of files in a given directory at run time.

    > [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

Properties

  • Archive

    Gets or sets a value that determines whether a FileListBox control displays files that have Archive attributes.

    public bool Archive { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if files that have the Archive attribute will be displayed; otherwise false. The default is true.

    Remarks

    Use this property to specify the type of files to display in a FileListBox control, based on standard Archive file attribute used in the operating environment. Setting this property in code at run time resets the FileListBox control to display only those files that have the specified attribute.

    > [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • DataSource

    Gets or sets the data source for a ListControl.

    public object DataSource { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Object

      An object that implements the IList or IListSource interfaces, such as a DataSet or a Array. The default is null.

    Remarks

    This property should not be set for the FileListBox control; it is provided only because the FileListBox control inherits from ListBox.

    > [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • DisplayMember

    Gets or sets the property to display for this ListControl.

    public string DisplayMember { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A String that represents the name of an object property that is contained in the collection specified by the crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox.DataSource* property. The default is an empty string ("").

    Remarks

    This property should not be set for the FileListBox control; it is provided only because the FileListBox control inherits from ListBox.

    > [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • FileName

    Gets or sets the file name of the selected file in a FileListBox.

    public string FileName { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A String that contains the file name of the selected file.

    Remarks

    Setting the FileName property at run time will result in only that file being displayed in the FileListBox.

    > [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • Hidden

    Gets or sets a value that determines whether a FileListBox control displays files that have Hidden attributes.

    public bool Hidden { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if files that have the Hidden attribute will be displayed; otherwise false. The default is false.

    Remarks

    Use this property to specify the type of files to display in a FileListBox control, based on standard Hidden file attribute used in the operating environment. Setting this property in code at run time resets the FileListBox control to display only those files that have the specified attribute.

    > [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • ItemHeight

    Gets the height of an item in the ListBox.

    public int ItemHeight { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      This property is not required for the FileListBox control; the FileListBox does not support items of variable height. It is provided only because the FileListBox control inherits from ListBox.

      > [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • Items

    Gets the items that are contained in a ListBox.

    public System.Windows.Forms.ListBox.ObjectCollection Items { get; }

    Property Value

    • ListBox+ObjectCollection

      A ListBox+ObjectCollection representing the items in the DirListBox.

    Remarks

    This property should not be used for the DirListBox control; trying to add or remove directories from the collection could cause an exception. It is provided only because the DirListBox control inherits from ListBox.

    > [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • Items(Int32)

    Gets the items that are contained in a ListBox.

    public string Items[int Index] { get; }

    Parameters

    • Index
      Int32

      An Integer representing the index of the item.

    Property Value

    • String

      A ListBox+ObjectCollection that represents the items in the DirListBox.

    Remarks

    This property should not be used for the DirListBox control; trying to add or remove directories from the collection could cause an exception. It is provided only because the DirListBox control inherits from ListBox.

    > [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • Normal

    Gets or sets a value that determines whether a FileListBox control displays files that have Normal attributes.

    public bool Normal { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if files that have the Normal attribute will be displayed; otherwise false. The default is true.

    Remarks

    Use this property to specify the type of files to display in a FileListBox control, based on standard Normal file attribute used in the operating environment. Setting this property at run time resets the FileListBox control to display only those files that have the specified attribute.

    > [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • Path

    Gets or sets the current path for a FileListBox.

    public string Path { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A String that contains the current path, not including the file name.

    Remarks

    The value of the Path property is a string indicating a path, such as C:\Ob or C:\Windows\System. For a FileListBox control, the default is the current path when the control is created at run time.

    Use this property when you are building an application's file-browsing and manipulation capabilities. Setting the Path property has effects similar to the MS-DOS chdir command; relative paths are allowed with or without a drive specification. Specifying only a drive with a colon (:) selects the current directory on that drive.

    The Path property can also be set to a qualified network path without a drive connection using the following syntax: 

    \\servername\sharename\path

    Changing the value of Path for a FileListBox control generates an PathChange event.

    > [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • Pattern

    Gets or sets a value indicating the file names displayed in a FileListBox control at run time.

    public string Pattern { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string expression indicating a file specification, such as ".\" or "*.FRM". The default is "*.*", which returns a list of all files.

    Remarks

    The Pattern property plays a key role in designing an application's file-browsing and manipulation capabilities. Use Pattern in combination with other file-control properties to give the user ways to explore files or groups of similar files. For example, in an application dedicated to starting other programs, you could designate that only .exe files be displayed in the file list box (*.exe).

    In addition to using wildcard characters, you can also use multiple patterns separated by semicolons (;). For example, ".exe; \.bat" would return a list of all executable files and all MS-DOS batch files.

    Changing the value of the Pattern property generates a PatternChange event.

    > [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • ReadOnly

    Gets or sets a value that determines whether a FileListBox control contains files that have read-only attributes.

    public bool ReadOnly { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if files that have the ReadOnly attribute will be displayed; otherwise false. The default is true.

    Remarks

    Use the ReadOnly property for a FileListBox control to specify whether files that have read-only attributes are displayed in the file list or not.

    Note

    If the Normal property is set to true (the default), files that have read-only attributes are displayed regardless of the ReadOnly property setting.

    > [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • Sorted

    Gets a value indicating whether the items in a FileListBox are sorted alphabetically.

    public bool Sorted { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if items in the control are sorted; otherwise, false. The default is false.

    Remarks

    For the FileListBox control, Sorted always returns false.

    > [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • System

    Gets or sets a value that determines whether a FileListBox control displays files that have System attributes.

    public bool System { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if files that have the System attribute will be displayed; otherwise false. The default is true.

    Remarks

    Use this property to specify the type of files to display in a FileListBox control, based on standard System file attribute used in the operating environment. Setting this property at run time resets the FileListBox control to display only those files that have the specified attribute.

    > [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • ValueMember

    Gets or sets the property to use as the actual value for the items in a ListControl.

    public string ValueMember { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A String representing the name of an object property that is contained in the collection specified by the crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox.DataSource* property. The default is an empty string ("").

    Remarks

    This property should not be set for the FileListBox control; it is provided only because the FileListBox control inherits from ListBox.

    > [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

    Raises the DoubleClick event.

    protected override void OnDoubleClick (EventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      EventArgs

      A EventArgs that contains the event data.

    Remarks

    Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see NIB: Raising an Event.

    The OnDoubleClick method also enables derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

Events

  • PathChange

    Occurs when the path is changed by setting the crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox.FileName* or crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox.Path* property in code.

    public event EventHandler PathChange;

    Remarks

    You can use a PathChange event procedure to respond to path changes in a FileListBox control. When you assign a string that contains a new path to the FileName property, the FileListBox control invokes the PathChange event.

    > [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • PatternChange

    Occurs when the file listing pattern, such as ".\", is changed by setting the crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox.FileName* or crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox.Pattern* property in code.

    public event EventHandler PatternChange;

    Remarks

    You can use a PatternChange event procedure to respond to pattern changes in a FileListBox control. When you assign a string that contains a new pattern to the FileName property, the FileListBox invokes the PathChange event.

    > [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008.
